ui.experience_intro: My professional journey reflects my curiosity to understand how systems work from the inside out. I have navigated through software development, project management, and network infrastructure, always with the same premise: building solid, scalable solutions and being there to ensure their technical evolution.
ui.formation_intro: My academic background and technical certifications. A record of my continuous learning journey to understand the foundations of engineering and new technologies.
ui.technologies_intro: This space isn't just a list of icons; itâ€™s the journey of my technical curiosity. Here, you'll find the tools I chose to 'marry,' like Python, alongside those I mastered out of necessity â€”or the adrenalineâ€” of solving critical problems in my career. It is my personal toolbox, forged between the code I was trained for and the professional demands that shaped me at every turn.

home.bio: Developer focused on IT systems and services. Passionate about creating efficient architectures and ensuring their technical maintenance and evolution.

player.toast_msg: Hey, something more personal: sharing my live radio with you ðŸŽµ

experience.comentarios_personales: Given the performance and commitment I showed in technical support, I was entrusted with the opportunity to join the ISP's service infrastructure team. Currently, I am responsible for maintaining, controlling, and monitoring the core network, always seeking to propose improvements and solutions to complex infrastructure problems. I have deepened my knowledge in the systems used, facing a constant challenge where I put my technical skills into practice to ensure the stability of a massive service.

In this role, I focused on the development of custom conversational solutions. I designed chatbots capable of managing customers and connecting with pre-existing company systems, incorporating databases to gather valuable information later processed through data science. It was a meticulous task of digital identity adjustment, where I used various scripts and APIs to meet specific customer service flow demands.

I had the opportunity to be part of a tech startup in a highly innovative project: the development of a full SaaS oriented toward network equipment management. I worked through the entire cycle, from base infrastructure conception to the final service received by the customer. Along with the team, we built solid demos and full functionalities, integrating hardware, proprietary software, and scalable network environments. Unfortunately, the project was paused due to a lack of technical development equipment before launching the product, but the experience gained was invaluable to my professional growth.

After finishing my university education, I entered the ISP world providing network technical support. Beyond the daily technical requirements, this stage was fundamental for polishing my soft skills: direct interaction with people and problem-solving under pressure. It allowed me to get an inside look at the integral functioning of an internet provider and what it takes to maintain an active service for thousands of users.

I joined through a temporary contract to be part of the development team for a virtual wallet. Working under agile methodologies (Scrum), I participated in dailies and followed modern software development standards. My focus was on the FrontEnd using Angular and managing deployment with Nginx, ensuring smooth interfaces and maintainable code within a corporate environment.

During this stage, I took on the responsibility of managing and directing projects coming into the company. My work ranged from developing web portals to custom management platforms, adapting them to the digital presence, message, and intent of each client. In addition to technical direction, I was in charge of training clients and internal staff on the use of the dedicated web components we developed, as well as on cybersecurity best practices to protect their digital assets.

As an independent worker, I managed various contracts focused on providing custom technical solutions. I have had the opportunity to work on creating monitoring systems, databases, automation scripts, and API integration/development, among other solutions that are autonomous and well-documented. My commitment goes beyond the initial delivery, as I continue providing assistance and remote monitoring to ensure the service and systems evolve according to the customer's needs.

Alongside my work as a developer, I maintain a portfolio of trusted clients who turn to me for corrective and preventive maintenance of their equipment. I am responsible for hardware installation, repair, and optimization, establishing a relationship based on trust and deep technical knowledge of their workstations and specific needs.

During my university years, I was an active member of the teaching team for the Programming I department. My role consisted of providing direct assistance to students in their first steps with programming, sharing ideas and opinions to improve the learning dynamic. It was an enriching experience where I not only taught Python and logic but also learned to convey complex concepts in a clear and collaborative way.

formation.comentarios_personales: With prior work experience, I decided to formally academicize my profession. I graduated with honors, consolidating my definitive transition into software development and IT systems. It was a time of gratitude and rediscovering my true technical calling.

Intensive training focused on the modern development stack. I covered the entire cycle: from server and database administration to Back-end and Front-end development. This diploma was key to mastering object-oriented programming and understanding how to create solid user experiences on web and mobile.

An exhaustive program where I certified my technical operational skills. I focused on technical hardware support, data networking, and fiber optic installation. It allowed me to standardize my knowledge in IT security and maintenance under international IT industry standards.

I started my university path in this branch of engineering, completing subjects up to the 4th year. Although my life took a definitive turn toward systems, today I still appreciate and use the technical training and infrastructure vision obtained in this career. It was the foundation of my calculation and planning skills.

High-level technical training focused on the complete lifecycle of outside plant (OSP) projects. The course covers everything from engineering design and field surveying to final execution and certification. I have deepened my knowledge in optical budget calculations, FTTH topologies, and advanced use of measurement instruments (OTDR/Power Meter), enabling me to technically lead the expansion and optimization of the ISP's fiber services.

technologies.name: Python
technologies.comment: Itâ€™s the tool I feel most at home with; thereâ€™s always a library available to solve any challenge. I decided to dive deep and 'marry' this language. Iâ€™ve built APIs, scripts, automations, tests, and monitoring systems. Along the way, searching for these solutions taught me a great deal about network and system communication processes.

technologies.name: JavaScript
technologies.comment: This is my second best language. Itâ€™s everywhere, and although I find it has more depth than Python, having to use it in so many scenarios led me to truly understand and master it. Nowadays, I primarily use it for API structures, requests, and dynamic integrations.

technologies.name: Node.js
technologies.comment: The 'almighty' Node.js. It was one of my first touchpoints with technical maintenance through package and update management. Today, itâ€™s my go-to choice for deploying critical libraries, hosting services, and orchestrating modern backend processes.

technologies.name: Networking
technologies.comment: My time at the ISP and the need to deploy projects drove me to master how communications happen, learning standards, processes, and configuration media. It represents one of my greatest professional leaps: I went from hating networks to not being able to imagine my daily work without them, managing critical infrastructure and resolving major incidents.

technologies.name: Proxmox VE
technologies.comment: Working at an ISP required me to manage various virtualization environments, which motivated me to dig deep into Proxmox and set up my own home lab. I understand that virtualizing equipment or deploying dedicated systems is often the answer to an organization's critical demands and an indispensable tool for maintaining safe, isolated test environments.

technologies.name: Docker
technologies.comment: Using containers transformed how I deploy solutions, allowing me to isolate processes and standardize environments regardless of the underlying infrastructure. It greatly improves the portability of my scripts and apps, ensuring that what I develop and test in my lab works identically in production environments.

technologies.name: Databases
technologies.comment: Iâ€™ve had the opportunity to work with pre-existing architectures as well as designing my own from scratch. This experience has allowed me to specialize in performance diagnostics, understanding internal structures, and troubleshooting critical issues, giving me the technical judgment to decide which engine best suits each project's requirements.

technologies.name: Grafana
technologies.comment: I adopted Grafana the moment a colleague showed me its potential; I was captivated by its versatility and have used it as a fundamental pillar of response for any visualization need ever since. Itâ€™s my primary tool for turning complex data into actionable dashboards, allowing me to manage real-time monitoring, alerts, and statistics for critical infrastructure.

technologies.name: Flutter
technologies.comment: I learned it back when mobile apps were the primary demand from clients. It offers solid, fast, and versatile development with a great look and feel. Currently, I handle small to medium-scale applications when the project calls for it.

technologies.name: Firebase
technologies.comment: I utilized it when faced with a lack of in-house infrastructure for certain projects. Itâ€™s a powerful and rapid deployment solution, though it requires careful attention to costs as the project scales. If I had to deliver a demo in 48 hours, Firebase would be my safe bet for backend and hosting.

technologies.name: HTML
technologies.comment: The essential foundation of web development. Not much to say hereâ€”you simply have to know how to use it.

technologies.name: CSS
technologies.comment: I understand it and can work with it, but I haven't mastered it to perfection; frontend design is definitely not my strongest suit.

technologies.name: PHP
technologies.comment: Used for specific or flexible developments, as well as for maintaining legacy systems or those based on classic web structures.

technologies.name: WordPress
technologies.comment: This was my first technology and the engine behind my first professional jobs. I consider it an incredibly solid solution for clients seeking a fixed digital presence or structures that don't require complex scalability, allowing for quick and functional deployments.

technologies.name: BotMaker
technologies.comment: I am an implementer of this technology, which I consider a robust solution for optimizing the contact between a client and a service. It allows me to design intelligent conversation flows that automate processes, improving both user experience and organizational operational efficiency.

technologies.name: NGINX
technologies.comment: My go-to tool for web traffic orchestration. I use it as a reverse proxy and load balancer to ensure services are both accessible and secure. I have implemented advanced security configurations, SSL/TLS certificate management, and performance optimization in production environments, such as this portfolio deployed on Proxmox.

technologies.name: FTTH & Fiber Networks
technologies.comment: The physical core of my work at the ISP. I master the complete fiber optic cycle: from engineering design and optical budget calculations to field deployment and certification. My technical background allows me to manage GPON/EPON infrastructures, solving critical physical and logical layer issues to ensure service delivery.

technologies.name: Cloudflare
technologies.comment: I utilize the Cloudflare ecosystem as a critical security and connectivity layer for my infrastructure. I implement Cloudflare Tunnels to securely expose local services without opening ports, manage Zero Trust policies for access to administrative tools, and utilize the WAF to mitigate attacks and filter unwanted traffic before it reaches my Proxmox network.

me.name: Santiago Martinez
me.subtitle: Driven by systems architecture
me.foundations_text: At 28, I understand that technology is, above all, a form of construction. My professional path was initially forged in Civil Engineering. From that stage, I retain a structural vision: the conviction that no system can scale or endure without a solid and well-calculated foundation. That engineering mindset stays with me today in every line of code and every infrastructure design.
me.code_text: I found in Python more than just a tool; I found an ally that I decided to 'marry' professionally. I enjoy the elegance of its syntax to solve complex problems, whether creating APIs, automating processes, or designing monitoring systems. My time as a university teaching assistant taught me that the best way to master logic is to have the ability to explain it in a simple and human way.
me.networks_text: My present is tied to the heartbeat of an ISP. As a SysAdmin, I manage the infrastructure that keeps people connected. The adrenaline of resolving mission-critical incidents and the satisfaction of seeing a stable network are what define my daily professional life. From resenting networks in my early days, I have come to a point where I cannot imagine my career without them, specializing today in virtualization and high-availability environments.
me.closing_quote: I build solutions for systems to evolve, while always keeping the human element at the center of design.
me.future_text: My focus is set on continuous evolution. I do not merely seek stability, but rather challenges that force me out of my comfort zone. My goal is to immerse myself in diverse architectures, learning from robust systems as well as those with flaws, as I understand that every mistake is a lesson. I seek to broaden my horizons to connect with other environments and continue building solutions.
